instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spin up, no chime, no turn on
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board.
Corrosion to J6100, <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and from <CAPACITOR>C5017</CAPACITOR> to <CAPACITOR>C5008</CAPACITOR>.

It was dead, with green / orange light.

Replaced parts, no bad traces found, USonic cleaned.

Fan now spins up, CPU gets hot, no chime, no image or backlight, no light on USB mouse.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spin up, no chime, no turn on
threads.message: Corrosion around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, also check corrosion under SMC.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spin up, no chime, no turn on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 9877"]Corrosion around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, also check corrosion under SMC.....[/QUOTE]

Thanks man. Slapped another SMC on there, starting up now. Just got to sort out backlight now.

Thanks again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spin up, no chime, no turn on
threads.message:
Replaced backlight driver IC all working now.
Please mark as solved.
